billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Authorizes police services arrangements for particular areas under circumstances and conditions that maintain disinterest
summary: Authorizes police services arrangements for particular areas under circumstances and conditions that maintain disinterest.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1297

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 6, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DUANE  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Investigations and Govern-
         ment Operations

       AN ACT to amend the alcoholic  beverage  control  law,  in  relation  to
         providing funds for certain police services

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 128  of  the  alcoholic  beverage  control  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    3    3.  THIS  SECTION  DOES  NOT  PROHIBIT ANY POLICE COMMISSIONER, POLICE
    4  INSPECTOR, CAPTAIN, SERGEANT, ROUNDSMAN, PATROLMAN OR OTHER POLICE OFFI-
    5  CIAL OR SUBORDINATE OF ANY POLICE DEPARTMENT IN THE STATE FROM PROVIDING
    6  POLICE SERVICES, INCLUDING A PAID DETAIL ARRANGEMENT, FOR  A  PARTICULAR
    7  AREA WHILE ON DUTY; PROVIDED THAT:
    8    (A) ANY FUNDS SUPPORTING THAT ACTIVITY THAT COME DIRECTLY OR INDIRECT-
    9  LY FROM A LICENSEE ARE PROVIDED THROUGH AN ENTITY REPRESENTING MORE THAN
   10  ONE  LICENSEE AND ARE PAID BY THE ENTITY TO THE POLICE DEPARTMENT OR THE
   11  PUBLIC ENTITY OF WHICH THE DEPARTMENT IS A PART;
   12    (B) THE POLICE PERSONNEL ARE AT ALL TIMES UNDER  THE  COMMAND  OF  THE
   13  POLICE DEPARTMENT AND PERFORM LAW ENFORCEMENT DUTIES; AND
   14    (C)  THE  ARRANGEMENT  IS  APPROVED BY THE POLICE DEPARTMENT OR PUBLIC
   15  ENTITY OF WHICH THE DEPARTMENT IS A PART  AND  IS  OTHERWISE  CONSISTENT
   16  WITH APPLICABLE STATE OR LOCAL LAW.
   17    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01197-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to providing funds for certain police services
